contentrichtext.text: '''Martín Fernández de Navarrete y Ximénez de Tejada''' (November 9, 1765 - October 8, 1844), was a [[Spain|Spanish]] [[sailor]] and [[historian]] who rediscovered [[Bartolomé de las Casas|Las Casas]]' abstract of the log [[Christopher Columbus]] made on his first voyage. [[Image:Martín Fernandez de Navarrete. oleo anónimo. Museo Naval de España.jpg|thumb|right|250px| Oil painting of Fernández de Navarrete, from the Naval Museum of Spain.]] == Early life and career == He was born at [[Abalos]] and received part of his education at a [[seminary]] in [[Vergara]].<ref>{{CathEncy|wstitle=Martín Fernández Navarrete}}</ref> He entered the navy in 1780 and was later engaged in the unsuccessful operations in 1782 during the [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]], and afterwards in the suppression of Algerine [[pirate]]s. Ill-health compelled him for a time to withdraw from active service, but he devoted this forced leisure to historical research, and in 1789 he was appointed by the crown to examine the national archives relating to the maritime history of Spain. == Rejoining the navy == He rejoined the navy in 1793 and was present at the [[siege of Toulon]]. Afterwards he received command of a [[frigate]]. From 1797 to 1808 he held in succession various important posts in the ministry of marine. In 1808 the French invasion led to his withdrawal to [[Andalusia]], and the rest of his life was entirely devoted to literature. In 1819 appeared, as an appendix to the Academy's edition of ''[[Don Quixote]]'', his ''Vida de [[Cervantes]]'', and in 1825 the first two volumes of the ''Colección de los viajes y descubrimientos que hicieron por mar los españoles desde el fin del siglo XV'' (3rd vol., 1829; 4th vol., 1837). In 1837 he was made a senator and director of the academy of history. At the time of his death he was assisting in the preparation of the ''Colección de Documentos Inéditos para la Historia de España''. His ''Disertación sobre la Historia de la Nautica'' (1846) and ''Biblioteca Maritima Española'' (1851). were published posthumously. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{1911}} * Navarrete, Martín Fernández de (1825-37) ''Colección de los viages y descubrimientos que hicieron por mar los españoles desde fines del siglo XV: con varios documentos inéditos concernientes á la historia de la marina castellana y de los establecimientos españoles en Indias'', 4 vols., Madrid: Imprensa Real.[http://books.google.com/books?id=Jui6IGo47eQC&pg=PP5#v=onepage&q&f=false v.1] (1825), [http://books.google.com/books?id=2KYGAAAAQAAJ&pg=PP13#v=onepage&q&f=false v.2] (1825), [http://books.google.com/books?id=ESYW_1DUELoC&pg=PP5#v=onepage&q&f=false v.3] (1829), [http://books.google.com/books?id=jccLAAAAQAAJ&pg=PR1#v=onepage&q&f=false v.4] (1837). {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Navarrete, Martin Fernandez de | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 9, 1765 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = October 8, 1844 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Navarrete, Martin Fernandez de}} [[Category:1765 births]] [[Category:1844 deaths]] [[Category:Riojan people]] [[Category:Spanish naval officers]] [[Category:Maritime historians]] [[Category:Afrancesados]]
